intro: Stachycarpus andinus, commonly known as the Andean arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a starch source. Stachycarpus andinus thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in high-altitude regions.
